![Herbnara Farm (허브나라농원)](/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2635258_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Herbnara Farm opened in 1996 as the first herb-themed farm in Korea. The farm was started in a deep valley in Pyeongchang by a couple whose age added up to 100 years. At that time, the farm was just a small plot of land, but has expanded to the current 33,000 ㎡ and is one of Pyeongchangs representative tourist attractions. The farm offers ten themed gardens with over 150 herbs such as lavender and sage. Delicious dishes and drinks made with herbs cultivated on the farm are available at the restaurant and cafe. Visitors can also make herbal soap and candles in the herl classroom, and enjoy cultural events throughout the farm. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|• 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
• For more info: +82-33-335-2902| |opendate:|October 1, 1996| |parking:|Available (206 parking spaces)| |restdate:|Closed Tuesdays from November-April| |usetime:|May-October 09:00-18:00 / November-April 09:00-17:30
* Last admission 1 hr before closing| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Film Locations:|Drama - "Hotel King (2014)"
Variety program - "Running Man"| |Restrooms:|Available| |Parking Fees:|Free| |Available Facilities:|Herb garden, greenhouse, restaurant, cafe, stage, exhibition space, Republic of Turkiye exhibition hall, gift shop, experience center forest trail, accommodations| |Admission Fees:|[May-October]
Adults 8,000 won / Children 5,000 won

[November-April]
Adults 5,000 won / Children 3,000 won

* Free admission: Preschoolers accompanied by an adult| ## Detail Image ![/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2620163_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2620163_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2620164_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2620164_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2620166_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2620166_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2635249_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2635249_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2635252_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2635252_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2635253_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2635253_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2635257_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2635257_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2635261_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2635261_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2635263_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2635263_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2620165_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-28-1664351714370/2620165_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [☎️+82-33-335-2902](tel:+82333352902) - [🏠www.herbnara.com](http://www.herbnara.com/) ```googleMap latitude: 37.6390821263 longitude: 128.3411258270 title: 225, Heungjeonggyegok-gil, Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon-do ```

data.title: Herbnara Farm (허브나라농원)
data.description: Herbnara Farm opened in 1996 as the first herb-themed farm in Korea. The farm was started in a deep valley in Pyeongchang by a couple whose age added up to 100 years. At that time, the farm was just a small plot of land, but has expanded to the current 33,000 ㎡ and is one of Pyeongchangs representative tourist attractions. The farm offers ten themed gardens with over 150 herbs such as lavender and sage. Delicious dishes and drinks made with herbs cultivated on the farm are available at the restaurant and cafe. Visitors can also make herbal soap and candles in the herl classroom, and enjoy cultural events throughout the farm.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Mangyeongdae Pavilion (만경대)
dataList.description: Mangyeongdae Pavilion, located on the shore of the East Coast, one-kilometer east of Donghae City Hall, was built in 1613 while old Joseon was under the rule of King Gwanghaegun. However, the pavilion was destroyed by rainstorms and later rebuilt by the Samcheok Kim family some 60 years ago. While offering a spectacular view of sea to the east, the pavilion also offers a refreshing view of expansive pine forests to the north. If you look to the west, you will enjoy a magnificent view of Dutasan Mountain beyond the pavilion’s back lawn as well as the Jeoncheon Stream flowing into the East Sea alongside a steep cliff-wall. As only Jukseoru Pavilion of Samcheok matched its view, poets of former times are said to have frequented Mangyeongdae Pavilion.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Mangsang Beach (망상해변)
dataList.description: Mangsang Beach is sought out by many families and tourists for its beautiful white sand, lush pine forest, shallow waters, and location in a neighborhood full of convenient facilities. Mangsang Beach is located 3 kilometers north from Mukho Port and it represents the east coast, along with Okgye and Gyeongpo Beaches.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Lohas Park & Wacapuca (로하스파크&와카푸카)
dataList.description: Lohas Garden & WacaPuca is an eco-themed park located 700 meters above sea level in the highlands of Pyeongchang, Gangwon-do Province. Sitting in the most beautiful national forest of Phyeongchang (Total area 3,305,785㎡ Structural area 396,694㎡), Lohas Garden offers the most natural scenic views in Korea.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Lee Hyo-seok Culture Village (이효석문화마을)
dataList.description:
Lee Hyo-seok Culture Village is the place where the author Lee Hyo-seok (pen name “Gasan”) was born and raised. The village is also the setting of the author’s novel When the Buckwheat Blossoms,” one of the most celebrated Korean short stories to date.

In 1990, the village place was designated ‘first national cultural village’ by the Ministry of Culture and Tourism. The village is comprised of the authors birth house, a water mill, Gasan Park, Lee Hyo-seok Memorial Hall, and a buckwheat museum. During the peak of the blossoming season in early fall, the annual Lee Hyo-seok Cultural Festival takes place and visitors can enjoy the beautiful scenery of snow-white fields of buckwheat flowers.

Lee Hyo-seok Cultural Festival commemorates the modern Korean writer and features buckwheat-themed programs. Events include a Hyo-seok essay contest, traditional performances, a costume parade, a photo contest, and When the Buckwheat Blossoms plays and related performances. During the festival, visitors can enjoy makguksu (buckwheat noodles) and memil buchim (buckwheat pancakes) and tour the locations that appear in the famous short story.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Korean Peninsula-shaped Cliffs-Gangwon Paleozoic Geopark (한반도지형-강원고생대 국가지질공원)
dataList.description: Seonam Village is a small town located on the banks of the Seogang River in Yeongwol, Gangwon-do. The village is famous for its land formation that is shaped like the Korean peninsula, due to the river meandering around the village forming an outline in the shape of the peninsula. In the summer, many people come to enjoy rafting from the East Coast to the West Coast of the peninsula-like cliff formation, with Homigot in the south and Baekdusan Mountain in the North.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Kim Hain Art Hall Pension (김하인 아트홀 국화꽃향기)
dataList.description: Famous as a filming site for the popular K-drama Autumn in My Heart (2000), Kim Hain Art Hall opened in October 2008 in dedication to Kim Hain, the novelist of The Scent of Love. The center serves as a cultural space for students and general visitors. Spread over four floors, Kim Hain Art Hall doubles as an experience center and a pension, featuring a literature lecture room, author introduction room, a screening room, and moviestar room.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jumunjin Port (주문진항)
dataList.description: Jumunjin Port, one of the main fishing ports on the east coast, is home to over 350 fishing boats. The East Sea, where the warm and cold waters meet, is excellent for catching many different types of fish including lance fish, pollack, herring, and anchovy, as well as squid. Fish caught in the area is often served fresh or cooked at nearby seafood restaurants.
dataList.author: korea-tour
